subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In Japanese [[kanji]] and Korean [[hanja]], the left radical component is written <big>{{l|mul|𩙿}}</big> which is the historical form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}.
* In modern Chinese scripts (in [[traditional Chinese|traditional form]]), the left radical component is written <big>{{l|mul|飠}}</big> instead.
* In Taiwan, Hong Kong and Macau, the right component is written {{l|mul|sc=Hant|壬}} (the uppermost stroke is a horizontal {{l|mul|一}} line).
* In mainland China, Japan and Korea, the right component is written {{l|mul|sc=Hans|壬}} (the uppermost stroke is a slanting {{l|mul|㇒}} stroke written from the upper right position to the bottom left position).

subSections.title: Related characters
subSections.text:
* {{l|mul|[[餁]]}} ''({{w|Variant Chinese character|Variant}} [[traditional Chinese|traditional form]])''
* {{l|mul|[[饪]]}} ''([[Simplified Chinese]])''
